contents-list.explanation: very fashionable, stylish, or appealing in a way that is generally approved of especially by young people
samples: You look cool in those jeans.

contents-list.explanation: a duty, task, or function that someone or something has
samples: When I asked her to clean up the mess, she said, "That's not my job."

contents-list.explanation: to rest your mind and body by closing your eyes and becoming unconscious.
samples: Did you sleep well last night?

contents-list.explanation: to look at something carefully to find mistakes, problems, etc., or to make sure there is nothing wrong with it.
samples: Make sure to check your spelling.

contents-list.explanation: a substance that is used in treating disease or relieving pain and that is usually in the form of a pill or a liquid.
samples: He forgot to take his medicine.

contents-list.explanation: to cause the death of a person, an animal or a plant.
plants that have narrow green leaves, that are eaten by cows, sheep, horses, etc., and that are commonly grown on lawns and in gardens
samples: It's time to cut the grass.

contents-list.explanation: a part or section within a larger place.
samples: The area is surrounding the lake.
He has learned a hard lesson.
He is at home sick in bed.

contents-list.explanation: a person who cuts and shapes hair.
samples: I asked my hairdresser to cut my hair.

contents-list.explanation: a person who is skilled in the science of medicine.
samples: I think you should see a doctor.

contents-list.explanation: a person whose job is to drive a taxi.
samples: We told the taxi driver to take us to the library.

contents-list.explanation: a person who flies an airplane, helicopter, etc.
samples: Jerry wants to be an airline pilot.

contents-list.explanation: a person who acts in a play, movie, etc.
samples: His wife is also an actor.

contents-list.explanation: a person whose job is to care for people's teeth.
samples: I have an appointment with my dentist today.

contents-list.explanation: a person whose job is to help the customers in a store.
samples: The shop assistant lauphed with him and gave him his money back.

contents-list.explanation: a member of a group that works to put out fires.
samples: It took firefighters over two hours to put out the fire.
